intro: Parechites bowringii, commonly known as the Bowring's spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
